long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The latest wine release now builds and requires wine-sysvinit on Fedora.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
wine-desktop-1.9.23-1
How reproducible:
Every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf install wine (or with previous wine packages installed, dnf upgrade)
Actual results:
Dependencies resolved. =========================================================================================================================================================== Package Arch Version Repository Size =========================================================================================================================================================== Installing: wine-sysvinit noarch 1.9.23-1.fc24 updates 55 k
[snip]
Expected results:
dnf does not install wine-sysvinit
Additional info:
git commit 293b55b35a26a90927f7d6f3df04c8522499ee8b includes the following changes to wine.spec which cause sysvinit sub-package to be built (and required) on Fedora. Those two "%if 0%{?rhel} < 7" lines should also test for Fedora - something like "%if 0%{?rhel} < 7 || 0%{?fedora} < 23" maybe?
@@ -353,8 +336,9 @@ Requires(postun): systemd %description systemd Register the wine binary handler for windows executables via systemd binfmt handling. See man binfmt.d for further information. +%endif
-%if 0%{?fedora} < 23 +%if 0%{?rhel} < 7 %package sysvinit Summary: SysV initscript for the wine binfmt handler Group: Applications/Emulators
[snip]
@@ -394,6 +377,9 @@ Requires: wine-common = %{version}-%{release} %if 0%{?fedora} >= 15 || 0%{?rhel} >= 7 Requires: wine-systemd = %{version}-%{release} %endif +%if 0%{?rhel} < 7 +Requires: wine-sysvinit = %{version}-%{release} +%endif Requires: hicolor-icon-theme BuildArch: noarch
